DOCNAME: CASE OF DOUIYEB v. THE NETHERLANDS
CONCLUSION: No violation of Art. 5-1;No violation of Art. 5-4
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP national and was born in DATE . He lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the course of an investigation into offences against public decency following complaints filed with the police , the assistant public prosecutor ( hulpofficier van justitie ) , in accordance with Articles DATE of LAW ( Wetboek PERSON , hereinafter “ CCP ” ) , issued a warrant for the applicant ’s arrest on suspicion of contravening LAW ( PERSON , hereinafter referred to as “ ORG ” ) , which provision prohibits trafficking in persons ( mensenhandel ) .

CARDINAL . On the basis of this warrant the police arrested the applicant in his home on DATE at TIME and brought him to the police station . According to the formal police report on this arrest ( proces - verbaal van aanhouding ) of DATE , the police officers identified themselves and , upon request of the member of the applicant ’s family who answered the door , showed the warrant for the applicant ’s arrest when they entered the applicant ’s home and arrested him in relation to an offence under LAW . This police report further states that the applicant was provided with a copy of the arrest warrant . The formal police report does not mention at what time the applicant was provided with this copy .

CARDINAL . On DATE , at TIME , the applicant was questioned by CARDINAL police officers . In so far as relevant , the formal police report on this questioning ( proces - verbaal van verhoor ) states as follows :
( Translation )
“ After we had informed the suspect that he was not obliged to answer and also informed him what he was to be questioned about , he stated to us as follows :

‘ I understand what I am suspected of . I understand you well . I do not understand for what I have been arrested . I have no statement to make , I want to speak to my lawyer first . I will not sign anything.’
After his statement had been read out to him , he agreed with it , but refused to sign it . ”

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , after the applicant had been brought before the assistant public prosecutor , the latter ordered the applicant ’s detention in police custody ( inverzekeringstelling ) for a maximum of DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the wording of the custody order , the applicant ’s custody had been ordered at TIME on suspicion of having contravened LAW . The relevant legal qualification was stated to be “ living off immoral earnings ” ( koppelarij ) . The custody order further stated that the applicant and his lawyer had been provided with a copy of the custody order without delay ( onverwijld ) . The custody order does not contain an indication as to the exact time the applicant and his lawyer were provided with a copy of this order .

CARDINAL . On the cover page of the police investigation file and in the formal police report on the investigation in the present case , both dated DATE , it is recorded that the applicant , together with another person , was suspected of contravening LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) in order to be heard and on the prosecution ’s request to order the applicant ’s detention on remand ( inbewaringstelling ) , which written request was based on LAW and referred to the offence set out therein . During this hearing , the applicant was assisted by his lawyer .
CARDINAL . The applicant denied the suspicions against him , explaining :
( Translation )

“ I only run errands for the girls . I know girls from GPE , GPE , GPE and the GPE . I pick them up with the car and bring them home . I do so at their own request . I earn MONEY per day with that [ activity ] . ”
In response to the public prosecutor ’s demand , the applicant stated :
( Translation )
“ Everything is falling apart on me , my marriage and my children . If my family becomes aware that I am involved in trafficking in women , they will kill me . ”

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s lawyer submitted that the applicant had been placed in police custody on suspicion of contravening LAW , for which offence police custody can not be ordered . He demanded the applicant ’s immediate release .
CARDINAL . According to TIME of this hearing , the investigating judge ordered the applicant ’s detention on remand , holding :
( Translation )

“ I , investigating judge , inform the suspect , as I do not find the police custody unlawful , that as to the submissions – however well - founded in fact they may be – regard must be had to the nature of the infringed rule(s ) , the interest protected by such rule(s ) , the degree to which this interest may be considered as having been harmed and the relevant interests of society . ”
CARDINAL . The written order for the applicant ’s detention on remand ( bevel tot bewaring ) issued by the investigating judge , in so far as relevant , reads :
( Translation )

“ … as it is plausible that the suspect is to a considerable extent involved in trafficking in persons ; that the pre - trial detention is in all reasonability necessary to … reveal the truth as [ the ] suspect denies [ the offence ] and ( a ) further witness(es ) need(s ) to be heard ;
NOTING the contents of … Article(s ) CARDINAL ter Criminal Code/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ;
ISSUES an order for detention on remand against [ the ] suspect for a period of DATE … ”

CARDINAL . Following the prosecution ’s request for the applicant ’s further detention on remand ( gevangenhouding ) , ORG ( ORG ) of GPE , after having heard the applicant and after having noted the grounds on which the applicant ’s detention on remand had been ordered and having found these grounds still to be pertinent , on DATE ordered the applicant ’s further detention on remand for a period of DATE . On DATE , the applicant was released for lack of space for further detainees in any remand centre .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG of GPE acquitted the applicant of the charges brought against him under LAW . On DATE , in a different set of proceedings concerning unrelated facts , ORG of GPE convicted him of unlawful possession of a firearm and sentenced him to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant filed a request under LAW ORG for compensation in respect of damage sustained on account of the time spent in pre - trial detention on suspicion of committing the offences of which he had been acquitted . Instead of seeking pecuniary compensation , the applicant requested ORG to order the deduction of the time he had spent in pre - trial detention from the CARDINAL GPE imprisonment to which he had been sentenced in the other set of criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . In its decision of DATE , ORG noted that the applicant had been taken into police custody on DATE on suspicion of committing an offence under LAW , that on DATE the investigating judge had ordered the applicant ’s detention on remand and that he had been released for lack of space on DATE . Pursuant to LAW and LAW ORG , ORG ordered that DATE be deducted from the CARDINAL GPE imprisonment imposed for the other offence ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . As to the remaining DATE , the applicant has successfully sought a royal pardon , these DATE having been commuted to CARDINAL ORG work .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , a public prosecutor is competent to order the arrest of a person suspected of having committed a criminal offence in respect of which pre - trial detention ( voorlopige hechtenis ) may be ordered .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW ORG , a public prosecutor or assistant public prosecutor is competent to order a person ’s detention in police custody , after having seen and heard that person , who is entitled to be assisted by a lawyer .

CARDINAL . According to LAW ORG , a custody order can only be issued in respect of punishable offences for which pre - trial detention may be ordered . A custody order is only valid for a maximum of DATE and may be prolonged once for a maximum period of DATE . No appeal lies against a custody order .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ORG requires that DATE and TIME after being arrested , a suspect must be brought before an investigating judge in order to be heard . On that occasion the suspect may request the investigating judge , in accordance with Article QUANTITY § CARDINAL ORG , to order his or her release . Where the investigating judge finds the order for detention in police custody ( inverzekeringstelling ) unlawful , the suspect ’s immediate release must be ordered ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ORG ) .

CARDINAL . In order to prolong the detention of a suspect , the public prosecutor can request the investigation judge for a remand order ( inbewaringstelling ) under LAW ORG . Pursuant to LAW ORG this remand order is valid for a period of maximum DATE .

CARDINAL . Although no direct appeal lies against a remand order , a person whose detention on remand has been ordered can , in accordance with LAW , apply to ORG for an order lifting the pre - trial detention ( opheffing voorlopige hechtenis ) . Under LAW ORG , an appeal against a rejection by ORG of a first request to lift pre - trial detention may be lodged with ORG ( Gerechtshof ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In order to prolong the detention of a suspect whose remand has been ordered by the investigation judge , the public prosecutor can request ORG for an order for further detention on remand ( gevangenhouding ) . Pursuant to LAW ORG this order is valid for a period of maximum DATE . Under LAW ORG , an appeal against an order for further detention on remand lies with ORG .

CARDINAL . According to the established case - law of ORG ( PERSON ) , procedural defects occurring in respect of previous orders for pre - trial detention do not constitute independent grounds for dismissing an application for a subsequent category of pre - trial detention . A judge must examine for each category separately whether all conditions are fulfilled ( see HR ( PERSON ) , CARDINAL DATE , GPE ( PERSON ) , DATE , no . CARDINAL ; HR , DATE , GPE DATE , no . CARDINAL ; and HR , DATE , GPE DATE , no . CARDINAL ) . However , in deciding requests under LAW ORG , a judge may take procedural defects into consideration as a relevant factor ( see HR , DATE , GPE DATE , no . CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ORG reads as follows :
“ CARDINAL . An order for pre - trial detention can be issued in case of suspicion of :
( a ) an offence which , according to the law , carries a punishment of imprisonment of DATE or more ;
( b ) CARDINAL of the offences defined in ORG CARDINAL , CARDINAL bis , CARDINAL § CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINALc , CARDINAL and CARDINAL bis of LAW ;
( c ) the misdemeanour described in LAW , under QUANTITY , of LAW ;
( d ) CARDINAL of the offences defined in :
– Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW DATE ;
– Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW ;
– Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL § CARDINAL and QUANTITY on Conscientious Objections to Military Service ;
– LAW ;
– LAW ;
– Article CARDINAL of the Stockbroking Control Act ;
– Article QUANTITY Act on LAW .

CARDINAL . The order can further be issued if no permanent address or place of residence of the suspect in the GPE can be established and he is suspected of an offence within the jurisdiction of the courts and which , according to the law , is punishable by imprisonment .
CARDINAL . The previous paragraphs are only applied when it appears from the facts or circumstances that there are serious indications against the suspect . ”
( “ CARDINAL . Een bevel tot voorlopige hechtenis kan worden gegeven in geval van verdenking van :
a. een misdrijf waarop naar de wettelijke omschrijving een gevangenisstraf van vier jaren of meer is gesteld ;
b. een der misdrijven omschreven in de artikelen CARDINAL , CARDINAL bis , CARDINAL , eerste lid , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINALc , CARDINAL en CARDINAL bis van het GPE ;
c. de overtreding omschreven in artikel CARDINAL , onder QUANTITY , van het Wetboek van Strafvordering ;
d. een der misdrijven omschreven in :
– artikel CARDINAL , tweede lid , PERSON DATE ;
– artikel CARDINAL , tweede lid , van de Wet buitengewone bevoegdheden burgerlijk gezag ;
– de artikelen CARDINAL , DATE , eerste lid , en CARDINAL van de Wet gewetensbezwaren militaire dienst ;
– artikel CARDINAL PERSON op de kansspelen ;
– artikel CARDINAL , tweede lid , PERSON ;
– artikel CARDINAL PERSON toezicht effectenverkeer DATE ;
– artikel DATE , eerste en tweede lid , van de Wet wapens en munitie .

CARDINAL . Het bevel kan voorts worden gegeven indien CARDINAL vaste woon- of verblijfplaats in GPE PERSON kan worden vastgesteld en hij verdacht wordt van een misdrijf waarvan de rechtbanken kennis nemen en waarop , naar de wettelijke omschrijving , gevangenisstraf is gesteld .
CARDINAL . De voorgaande leden van dit artikel vinden alleen toepassing wanneer uit feiten of omstandigheden blijkt van ernstige bezwaren tegen de verdachte . ” )
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL ORG provides as follows :
“ CARDINAL . The following persons shall be punished :

CARDINAL ° any person who intentionally causes or encourages his minor child , foster child or adopted child , his ward , a minor entrusted to him for care , education or supervision , or a servant or subordinate who is a minor , to commit an indecent act with another person , shall be liable to a term of imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fourth - category fine .

CARDINAL ° any person who intentionally causes or encourages a minor who he knows to be or may reasonably be expected to know to be a minor to commit an indecent act with another person , other than in the cases defined under QUANTITY , shall be liable to a term of imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fourth - category fine .
CARDINAL . If the offender has made a profession or habit of committing the indictable offence , the terms of imprisonment may be increased by CARDINAL . ”
( “ CARDINAL . ORG gestraft :

CARDINAL ° met gevangenisstraf van QUANTITY of geldboete PERSON , hij die het plegen van ontucht door zijn minderjarig kind , stiefkind of pleegkind , zijn pupil , een aan zorg , opleiding of waakzaamheid toevertrouwde minderjarige or zijn minderjarige bediende of ondergeschikte met een derde opzettelijk teweegbrengt of bevordert .

CARDINAL ° met gevangenisstraf van QUANTITY of een geldboete PERSON , hij die , buiten de gevallen genoemd onder QUANTITY , het plegen van ontucht door een minderjarige PERSON of redelijkerwijs moet vermoeden , met een derde opzettelijk teweeg CARDINAL of bevordert .
CARDINAL . Indien de schuldige van het plegen van het misdrijf een gewoonte maakt , PERSON met een derde worden verhoogd . ” )
CARDINAL . LAW states as follows :
“ CARDINAL . The following persons commit be the offence of trafficking in persons and are liable to a punishment of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment or a fifth - category fine :

CARDINAL ° any person who induces another person to engage in prostitution by means of violence or any other physical action or by means of threats of violence or of any other physical action or by misusing authority or influence derived from the actual state of affairs , or by means of deception , or who under any of these circumstances undertakes any action which he or she knows or may reasonably be expected to know will lead to the other person becoming engaged in prostitution ;
CARDINAL ° any person who recruits , takes with him or abducts any person with a view to inducing the latter to engage in prostitution in another country ;

CARDINAL ° any person who induces another person to engage in prostitution , or who , as regards this other person , undertakes any action which he or she knows or may reasonably be expected to know will lead to the other person becoming engaged in prostitution , if the other person is a minor .
CARDINAL . The penalty for the following offences shall be DATE imprisonment or a fifth - category fine :
CARDINAL ° trafficking in persons , committed by CARDINAL or more persons acting in concert ;
CARDINAL ° trafficking in persons , where the victim is aged DATE ;
CARDINAL ° trafficking in persons , if violence or any other physical action referred to in paragraph CARDINAL results in serious bodily harm .

CARDINAL . Trafficking in persons , committed by CARDINAL or more persons acting in concert , under circumstances set out in paragraph CARDINAL under QUANTITY , shall be punishable by DATE imprisonment or a fifth - category fine . ”
( “ CARDINAL . Als schuldig aan mensenhandel wordt gestraft met gevangenisstraf PERSON jaren of geldboete PERSON :

CARDINAL ° degene die een ander door geweld of een andere feitelijkheid of door bedreiging met geweld of een andere feitelijkheid dan wel door misbruik van uit feitelijke verhoudingen voortvloeiend overwicht of door misleiding tot prostitutie brengt , dan wel onder voornoemde omstandigheden enige handeling onderneemt QUANTITY of redelijkerwijs moet vermoeden dat die ander daardoor in de prostitutie belandt ;
CARDINAL ° degene die een persoon aanwerft , medeneemt of ontvoert met het oogmerk die persoon in een ander land in de prostitutie te brengen ;

CARDINAL ° degene die een ander tot prostitutie brengt , dan wel CARDINAL aanzien van een ander enige handeling onderneemt QUANTITY of redelijkerwijs moet vermoeden dat die ander daardoor in de prostitutie belandt , indien die ander minderjarig is .
CARDINAL . Met gevangenisstraf van QUANTITY of een geldboete PERSON gestraft :
CARDINAL ° mensenhandel door twee of CARDINAL verenigde personen ;
CARDINAL ° mensenhandel ten aanzien van een persoon die de leeftijd van zestien jaren nog niet heeft bereikt ;
CARDINAL ORG mensenhandel , indien geweld of een andere feitelijkheid als bedoeld in het eerste lid , zwaar lichamelijk letsel QUANTITY gevolge heeft .
CARDINAL . GPE door twee of meer verenigde personen onder de omstandigheden , bedoeld in het tweede lid onder QUANTITY , wordt gestraft met gevangenisstraf PERSON jaren of geldboete PERSON . ” )
